description: Official 2026 Selective Entry Practice - Initial Release

questions.text: In the figure below, $ABCD$ is a square with side length 10. Point $E$ is on $BC$ such that $BE = 3$. $F$ is a point on $CD$ such that $\angle EAF = 45^\circ$. Find the length of $FD$.
questions.explanation:
Let us set up a coordinate system with $A$ at $(0,10)$, $B$ at $(10,10)$, $C$ at $(10,0)$, and $D$ at $(0,0)$. Wait, standard orientation: $A(0,10)$ is top-left? Let's use standard Cartesian: $A(0,0)$, $B(10,0)$, $C(10,10)$, $D(0,10)$.

Given:
$ABCD$ is a square side 10.
$E$ is on $BC$. $B$ is $(10,0)$, $C$ is $(10,10)$. $BE=3$. Since $E$ is on $BC$, $E$ is $(10,3)$.
$F$ is on $CD$. $C$ is $(10,10)$, $D$ is $(0,10)$. $F$ has coordinates $(x, 10)$. Let $DF = x$. Then $F$ is $(x, 10)$. Wait, $D$ is $(0,10)$, so distance from $D$ to $F$ along $y=10$ is $x$. So $F$ is $(x, 10)$.

We require $\angle EAF = 45^\circ$.
Line $AE$ slope $m_1 =  rac{3-0}{10-0} = 0.3$.
Line $AF$ slope $m_2 =  rac{10-0}{x-0} =  rac{10}{x}$.

The angle $	heta$ between two lines with slopes $m_1, m_2$ is given by $	an 	heta = \left|  rac{m_2 - m_1}{1 + m_1 m_2} ight|$.
Here $	heta = 45^\circ$, so $	an 45^\circ = 1$.
$1 =  rac{ rac{10}{x} - 0.3}{1 + 0.3( rac{10}{x})}$ (assuming $F$ is to the left of the line where angle is larger, slopes are positive in this quadrant setup).
$1 =  rac{ rac{10 - 0.3x}{x}}{ rac{x + 3}{x}} =  rac{10 - 0.3x}{x + 3}$.
$x + 3 = 10 - 0.3x$
$1.3x = 7$
$x =  rac{7}{1.3} =  rac{70}{13}$.

Thus $FD =  rac{70}{13}$.

questions.text: Three of the following four words are similar in meaning. Select the **ODD ONE OUT**.
questions.explanation: **Enduring** means lasting over a long period; durable. \n\n*Ephemeral*, *Fleeting*, *Transient*, and *Temporary* all describe things that last for a very short time. Therefore, 'Enduring' is the antonym to the others and is the odd one out.
